flowRoot.flowPara: Get ready for a fun adventure into the world of scientific computing. Before getting down to coding on any machine, you might need to install Python and set up proxies. Flip to the back of this book to remind you how.

To create a new environment, see Setting up a new environment at the back of the book. Or, to get into an existing environment, called myenv in this example, open an Anaconda prompt (Windows) or Terminal (Mac and Linux), and type:

If you find an interesting package (aka library) and want to use it in your programs, you'll have to install it in your environment first. Look in the README or documentation for information about installing the package. Often it will be available via pip or conda. To install coolpackage with conda, type:
If it's only available via pip, you would type:
or, if you use a proxy (replace the URL with your actual proxy address):
There are lots of ways to run Python. You can start a simple interpreter:
To run a Python script, e.g. a .py file like this →
